column1: Mohamed Saïd Benrahma (Arabic: سعيد بن رحمة‎; born 10 August 1995) is an Algerian professional footballer who plays as a winger for Premier League club West Ham United
column3: and the Algeria national team. He has previously played for Nice

column2: Benrahma began his youth career with Algerian club NRB Bethioua
column3: before moving to France and joining Balma SC
column4: Colomiers and then Ligue 1 club Nice in 2013. He made his professional debut under manager Claude Puel during the 2013–14 season
column5: but played most of his football for the club with the reserve team
column6: for whom he made 37 appearances and scored 11 goals between 2013 and 2016. Benrahma scored one goal in his three first team appearances during the 2014–15 season and scored a further two in 2015–16.Ankle injuries and the arrival of manager Lucien Favre led to Benrahma spending a large portion of his latter career with the club away on loan
column7: at Ligue 1 club Angers and Ligue 2 clubs Gazélec Ajaccio and Châteauroux. Benrahma departed the Stade de Nice in July 2018
column8: having made 18 appearances and scored three goals during his time with the club.

column2: Benrahma moved to England to join Championship club Brentford on a four-year contract
column3: with the option of a further year
column5: reported to be £2.7 million. He scored his first goal for the club on his third appearance
column6: in a 4–2 EFL Cup first round victory over Southend United on 14 August 2018. Six weeks later
column7: Benrahma was sent off for the first time in his Bees career after committing two bookable offences during a 2–2 draw with Reading on 29 September. After returning from injury in December
column8: Benrahma broke into the starting lineup and came into form in mid-January 2019
column9: scoring nine goals in 14 league matches. He was nominated for the January and February PFA Fans' Player of the Month awards and one of his three goals in a 5–1 win over Hull City was chosen as the Championship Goal of the Month for February and as Brentford's Goal of the Season. An ankle injury suffered in early April 2019 ended Benrahma's season
column10: by which time he had made 45 appearances and scored 11 goals.Benrahma missed Brentford's entire 2019–20 pre-season match programme and returned to competitive play in mid-August 2019
column11: before breaking back into the starting lineup late in the month. During a 2019–20 season in which his performances led to him being voted the Brentford Supporters' Player of the Year and named in the Championship PFA Team of the Year
column12: Benrahma made 46 appearances and scored 17 goals
column13: which included two hat-tricks. His performances during Brentford's run to the 2020 Championship play-off Final saw him win the January 2020 PFA Fans' Player of the Month and the July 2020 Championship Player of the Month awards. In addition
column14: he was nominated for the 2020 London Football Awards EFL Player of the Year award and the 2019–20 PFA Fans' Championship Player of the Year award.After second consecutive pre-season of transfer speculation
column15: Benrahma was left out of head coach Thomas Frank's matchday squads early in the 2020–21 regular season
column16: before making his first appearance of the season as a substitute for Sergi Canós after 73 minutes of a 1–1 draw with Millwall on 26 September 2020. He started the following match versus West London rivals Fulham in the EFL Cup and his performance and second goal in the 3–0 fourth round victory was recognised with the man of the match and Goal of the Round awards respectively.

column2: Benrahma joined Premier League club West Ham United on an initial season-long loan deal
column3: with an agreement to make the transfer permanent.

column2: Benrahma was called up to the Algeria national team for friendly matches against Guinea and Senegal. He made his debut in the match versus Senegal on 13 October 2015
column3: when he came on as a substitute for Baghdad Bounedjah after 70 minutes of the 1–0 victory. One month later
column4: Benrahma was called into the squad for two 2018 World Cup second round qualifiers versus Tanzania
column5: but did not make an appearance. Benrahma's club form at Brentford during the 2018–19 season was recognised with a call-up for two 2019 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers and he won his second international cap with a start in a 1–0 win over Tunisia on 26 March 2019. He was named in Algeria's preliminary squad for the 2019 Africa Cup of Nations
column6: but was forced to withdraw due to injury.

column1: Benrahma was born in Aïn Témouchent and grew up in Sidi Bel Abbès. He moved to Toulouse
column2: France with his parents at the age of 11 and holds a French passport. Benrahma's father died in January 2020 and he publicly dedicated each of his subsequent five goals to him.

column1: PFA Fans' Player of the Month: January 2020
EFL Championship Player of the Month: July 2020
Brentford Supporters' Player of the Year: 2019–20
Championship PFA Team of the Year: 2019–20
